description.narrative: The proposed Project Development Objective (PDO) is to improve the extent, quality, and accessibility of water resources information and to strengthen the capacity of targeted water resources management institutions in India.

condition.narrative: Annual Work Plans The Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall (a) by no later than January 31st of each year during the period ofimplementation of the Project, and with the participation the Project Implementing Entities, furnish to the Bank for its review andcomments a proposed Annual Work Plan and budget for the following fiscal year. Frequency :Yearly

Annual and Mid-term ReviewsBy no later than October 31st of each year during the period of implementation of the Project, theBorrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall carry out, with the participation of the Project Implementing Entities, an annual review of theProject.By no later than June 30, 2019 and June 30, 2022, the Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall carry out two (2) mid-termreviews of the Project, and shall incorporate the findings of such reviews in the work programs of subsequent years adjusting theProject outlay for the Project Implementing Entities based on their performance in agreement with the Bank. Frequency :Yearly

Budgetary Provisions and Funds Release:The Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall make its best efforts to: (a) provide sufficientbudgetary provisions to implement the Annual Work Plans referred to Section I.C of this Schedule, starting from fiscal year2017â€“18; and (b) ensure the release of funds for each subsequent fiscal year to all the Project Implementation Entities asmutually agreed between the Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR and the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Computerized Financial Management SystemThe Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall establish and thereafter maintain with theassistance of the Project Implementing Entities through the period of implementation of the Project, a computerized financialmanagement system. Due Date :31-Mar-2018

Financial Audit:The Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall, and shall cause each Project implementing Entity to, have the ProjectFinancial Statements audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 5.09 (b) of the General Conditions. The audited ProjectFinancial Statements for each such period shall be furnished to the Bank not later than nine (9) months after the end of suchperiod. Frequency :Yearly

National Water Information Center | Description :The Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall establish, and thereafter maintainthroughout the period of implementation of the Project, an independent National Water Informatics Center. Due Date :31-Mar-2018

Project Implementation Arrangements The Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall maintain, throughout the period of implementation ofthe Project, (a) the National Steering Committee, (b) the National Project Monitoring Unit, and (c) Central Project ManagementUnits in each of the Central (d) Regional Project Management Units. State Agencies. (a) The State Project Steering Committee;(b) The Project Management Units. Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Project Implementation Plan The Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall, and shall cause each of the Project Implementing Entities to,adopt and thereafter maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Project, the Project Implementation Plan in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Bank.. Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Technical and Management Consultant:The Borrower through MoWR, RD&GR shall engage under terms of reference satisfactory to theBank, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of implementation of the Project, a technical assistance and management supportconsultant to assist the National Project Monitoring Unit in the implementation of the Project. | Due Date :31-Aug-2017

title.narrative: Water resources monitoring stations along with historical data standardized and integrated with the national platform
Advanced flood forecasting systems developed for river basins
Water resources monitoring stations operated by implementing agencies providing validated data online
Water Resources Institutions achieving benchmark performance levels
Information products produced under the project made available to the relevant stakeholders
WRIS users satisfied with the services
Page views to access the information at WRIS
